com.jmex.physics
Class DynamicPhysicsNode

java.lang.Object
  com.jme.scene.SceneElement
      com.jme.scene.Spatial
          com.jme.scene.Node
              com.jmex.physics.PhysicsNode
                  com.jmex.physics.DynamicPhysicsNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jme.util.export.Savable, java.io.Serializable
public abstract class DynamicPhysicsNode
extends PhysicsNode

This PhysicsNode represents a physical entity that can be subject to forces to move and/or rotate it.

PhysicsNodes are created solely by the PhysicsSpace (methods PhysicsSpace.createDynamicNode() and PhysicsSpace.createStaticNode()).

Author:
Irrisor
See Also:
Serialized Form

setCenterOfMass

public abstract void setCenterOfMass(com.jme.math.Vector3f value)
Change the center of mass for this node. This moves the attached spatials to a suited position. So this method should be called _after_ configuring the geometries (e.g. after PhysicsNode.generatePhysicsGeometry()).

Parameters:
value - new center as vector in object coordinate space

addForce

public abstract void addForce(com.jme.math.Vector3f force,
                              com.jme.math.Vector3f at)
Add a force to be applied to this node at a given relative location. The force vector is given in world coordinate space. The force is applied in the next computation step and is cleared afterwards. Thus this method has to be called frequently (before each physics step) if a constant force should be applied.

Parameters:
force - force to be added (world coordinate space)
at - position of the object where the force should be applied (object coordinate space)
See Also:
PhysicsUpdateCallback

addForce

public void addForce(com.jme.math.Vector3f force)
Add a force to be applied to this node. The vector is given in world coordinate space.

Parameters:
force - force to be added
